com.datasift.client.historics

Class DataSiftHistorics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datasift.client.DataSiftApiClient
      • com.datasift.client.historics.DataSiftHistorics

  • public class DataSiftHistorics
extends DataSiftApiClient
    This class provides access to the DataSift Historics API.

        public FutureData<DataSiftResult> start(PreparedHistoricsQuery query)

      • start

        public FutureData<DataSiftResult> start(FutureData<PreparedHistoricsQuery> query)
        Start the historics query given
        Returns:
        a result which can be checked for success or failure, A status 204 indicates success, or using BaseDataSiftResult.isSuccessful()

      • start

        public FutureData<DataSiftResult> start(String id)
        Start the historics query with the given ID
        Parameters:
        id - the historics id
        Returns:
        a result which can be checked for success or failure, A status 204 indicates success, or using BaseDataSiftResult.isSuccessful()

        Parameters:

        reason - an optional ID
        Returns:
        the results of calling the stop API

      • update

        public FutureData<DataSiftResult> update(String id,
                                String name)
        Update the name of a historics query
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the historics to update
        name - the new name for the historics
        Returns:
        a result that can be used to check the success or failure of the request

      • status

        public FutureData<HistoricsStatus> status(org.joda.time.DateTime start,
                                 org.joda.time.DateTime end,
                                 String... sources)
        Check the status of data availability in our archive for the given time period
        Parameters:
        start - the dat from which the archive should be checked
        end - the up to which the archive should be checked
        sources - an optional list of data sources that should be queried, e.g. [facebook,twitter,...]
        Returns:
        a report of the current status/availability of data for the given time period

      • get

        public FutureData<HistoricsQuery> get(String id)

      • get

        public FutureData<HistoricsQuery> get(String id,
                             boolean withEstimate)
        Get detailed information about a historics query
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the historics to list
        withEstimate - if true then an estimated completion time is include in the response
        Returns:
        a historics query

      • list

        public FutureData<HistoricsQueryList> list(int max,
                                  int page,
                                  boolean withEstimate)
        Retrieve a list of HistoricsQuery objects
        Parameters:
        max - max number of objects to list
        page - a page number
        withEstimate - if true, include an estimated completion time
        Returns:
        an iterable list of HistoricsQuerys

      • prepare

        public FutureData<PreparedHistoricsQuery> prepare(String hash,
                                         org.joda.time.DateTime start,
                                         org.joda.time.DateTime end,
                                         String name)
        Parameters:
        hash - The hash of the CSDL for your historics query. Example values: 2459b03a13577579bca76471778a5c3d
        start - Unix timestamp for the start time. Example values: 1325548800
        end - nix timestamp for the end time. Must be at least 24 in the past. Example values: 1325548800
        name - The name you assign to your historics query. Example values: Football
        Returns:
        the prepared Historics

      • prepare

        public FutureData<PreparedHistoricsQuery> prepare(String hash,
                                         long start,
                                         long end,
                                         String name,
                                         String... sources)
        Parameters:
        hash - The hash of the CSDL for your historics query. Example values: 2459b03a13577579bca76471778a5c3d
        start - Unix timestamp for the start time. Example values: 1325548800
        end - nix timestamp for the end time. Must be at least 24 in the past. Example values: 1325548800
        name - The name you assign to your historics query. Example values: Football
        sources - Comma-separated list of data sources to include. Currently, the only source you can use is twitter. In the future, you will be able to choose any source listed as a valid value that you would use in the interaction.type target. Example values: twitter
        Returns:
        the prepared historics

      • prepare

        public FutureData<PreparedHistoricsQuery> prepare(String hash,
                                         long start,
                                         long end,
                                         String name,
                                         int sample,
                                         String... sources)
